intro: Schmaltzia anisophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed schmaltzia, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, with small, white or pale yellow flowers clustered in umbels. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive, slightly serrated edge, contributing to its ornamental value. Schmaltzia anisophylla is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
